title: Modal Perfects
description: Слушайте модальные перфектные конструкции для предположений о прошлом.

tasks.audioText: The office lights were on all night and nobody was working. Someone must have forgotten to turn them off before leaving yesterday evening.
tasks.transcript: Someone must have forgotten to turn them off before leaving yesterday evening.

options.text: The speaker is certain that somebody left the lights on by accident.
Someone deliberately left the lights on all night.
The lights turned off automatically at night.
Nobody was in the office yesterday evening.

tasks.explanation: 'Must have forgotten' expresses a strong deduction about the past. The speaker is almost sure someone accidentally left them on.

tasks.audioText: Sarah studied incredibly hard for the bar exam but still failed. She could have passed if she had managed her time more effectively during the test.
tasks.transcript: She could have passed if she had managed her time more effectively during the test.

options.text: Sarah passed the bar exam after studying hard.
Sarah had the ability to pass, but poor time management during the exam prevented it.
Sarah did not study at all for the bar exam.
Sarah will retake the exam with better time management.

tasks.explanation: 'Could have passed' indicates an unrealised past possibility. She was capable but failed due to time management issues.

tasks.audioText: The project deadline was missed by two weeks. The team leader should have allocated more resources to the critical development phase from the very beginning.
tasks.transcript: The team leader should have allocated more resources to the critical development phase from the very beginning.

options.text: The team leader successfully managed resources throughout the project.
It would have been better if the leader had assigned more resources to development earlier.
The project was completed ahead of schedule.
The team leader plans to allocate more resources to the next project.

tasks.explanation: 'Should have allocated' expresses regret or criticism about a past decision. More resources were needed from the start.

tasks.audioText: The restaurant was completely empty when we arrived at eight. The new management might have changed the opening hours without updating the website.
tasks.transcript: The new management might have changed the opening hours without updating the website.

options.text: The speaker is certain the restaurant changed its hours.
The website showed the correct opening hours.
The speaker suggests it is possible the new management altered the schedule but did not update online.
The restaurant was crowded when they arrived.

tasks.explanation: 'Might have changed' expresses a weaker possibility about the past. The speaker is unsure but offers a plausible explanation.

tasks.audioText: The accused was at a charity gala with two hundred witnesses at the time of the robbery. He can't have committed the crime because he has a watertight alibi.
tasks.transcript: He can't have committed the crime because he has a watertight alibi.

options.text: It is impossible that he committed the crime since his alibi is solid.
He probably committed the crime despite his alibi.
He might have committed the crime at the charity gala.
His alibi has not been verified yet.

tasks.explanation: 'Can't have committed' expresses a strong negative deduction. The speaker is certain he is innocent based on his alibi.

tasks.audioText: The marathon runner collapsed just metres from the finish line. He must have pushed himself far beyond his physical limits during the final kilometres of the race.
tasks.transcript: He must have pushed himself far beyond his physical limits during the final kilometres of the race.

options.text: The runner paced himself carefully throughout the entire marathon.
The speaker strongly believes the runner overexerted himself in the last stretch of the race.
The runner was disqualified before reaching the finish line.
The runner crossed the finish line successfully.

tasks.explanation: 'Must have pushed' is a confident deduction about what happened. The evidence (collapsing) supports extreme overexertion.

tasks.audioText: We waited at the airport for three hours but our colleague never showed up. She may have misunderstood the departure time or confused it with a different flight.
tasks.transcript: She may have misunderstood the departure time or confused it with a different flight.

options.text: The colleague arrived at the airport on time.
The speaker deliberately gave the colleague the wrong departure time.
It is possible that the colleague got the time wrong or mixed up the flights.
The colleague's flight was cancelled without notice.

tasks.explanation: 'May have misunderstood' expresses a reasonable possibility. The speaker speculates about two potential reasons for the no-show.

tasks.audioText: The company's stock price plummeted overnight after the earnings report. The board should have disclosed the financial difficulties to shareholders much earlier than they did.
tasks.transcript: The board should have disclosed the financial difficulties to shareholders much earlier than they did.

options.text: The board informed shareholders about financial problems at the right time.
The shareholders already knew about the financial difficulties.
The speaker criticises the board for not revealing the financial issues sooner.
The stock price rose after the earnings report.

tasks.explanation: 'Should have disclosed... much earlier' is a criticism about a past failure to act. The board waited too long to share bad news.

tasks.audioText: The ancient temple was built with stones weighing several tonnes each. The civilisation that constructed it must have possessed remarkably advanced engineering knowledge for its era.
tasks.transcript: The civilisation that constructed it must have possessed remarkably advanced engineering knowledge for its era.

options.text: The civilisation had very basic construction techniques.
Modern engineers built the ancient temple.
The speaker is almost certain that the ancient builders had sophisticated engineering skills for their time.
The stones used in the temple were very lightweight.

tasks.explanation: 'Must have possessed' makes a strong logical deduction about ancient capabilities based on the impressive construction evidence.

tasks.audioText: The diplomat resigned suddenly without giving any public explanation. He could have been pressured by senior government officials to step down from his position quietly.
tasks.transcript: He could have been pressured by senior government officials to step down from his position quietly.

options.text: The diplomat resigned voluntarily and happily.
It is possible that high-ranking officials forced the diplomat to resign discreetly.
The diplomat was definitely pressured to resign.
Senior officials publicly asked the diplomat to stay.

tasks.explanation: 'Could have been pressured' suggests a possibility, not a certainty, about external influence on his resignation.

tasks.audioText: The students' exam results were disappointing across the board. The teacher needn't have spent so much time on advanced topics when the basics were clearly not understood.
tasks.transcript: The teacher needn't have spent so much time on advanced topics when the basics were clearly not understood.

options.text: It was unnecessary for the teacher to focus so heavily on advanced material since students lacked fundamental knowledge.
The teacher should have spent even more time on advanced topics.
The students performed excellently on the exam.
The teacher did not cover any advanced topics at all.

tasks.explanation: 'Needn't have spent' means the action was done but was unnecessary. Time on advanced topics was wasted given the weak basics.

tasks.audioText: The hiker returned safely after being lost for two days in the mountains. She wouldn't have survived if she hadn't packed emergency supplies in her backpack.
tasks.transcript: She wouldn't have survived if she hadn't packed emergency supplies in her backpack.

options.text: The hiker survived because she brought emergency supplies with her.
The hiker did not bring any emergency supplies.
The hiker did not survive being lost in the mountains.
Emergency supplies were not important for her survival.

tasks.explanation: 'Wouldn't have survived if she hadn't packed' is a third conditional showing the supplies were essential. She did pack them and did survive.

tasks.audioText: The gallery owner examined the painting carefully with a magnifying glass. It can't have been painted by Vermeer because the pigments used were not available in the seventeenth century.
tasks.transcript: It can't have been painted by Vermeer because the pigments used were not available in the seventeenth century.

options.text: The painting was confirmed as a genuine Vermeer masterpiece.
It is impossible that Vermeer created this painting since the materials did not exist in his time.
Vermeer might have used unusual pigments in this particular work.
The gallery owner was unable to determine the painting's origin.

tasks.explanation: 'Can't have been painted by' expresses impossibility based on factual evidence — the pigments post-date Vermeer's lifetime.

tasks.audioText: The patient's condition improved dramatically overnight. The experimental medication they administered might have played a crucial role in the unexpectedly rapid recovery.
tasks.transcript: The experimental medication they administered might have played a crucial role in the unexpectedly rapid recovery.

options.text: The doctors are certain the medication caused the recovery.
The medication was never administered to the patient.
The patient's condition worsened despite the medication.
The experimental drug may have been a key factor in the surprisingly fast improvement.

tasks.explanation: 'Might have played' expresses a tentative possibility. The medication could be responsible but it is not confirmed.

tasks.audioText: The architect reviewed the collapsed bridge wreckage. The engineers should not have used substandard steel reinforcement bars in such a structurally critical component.
tasks.transcript: The engineers should not have used substandard steel reinforcement bars in such a structurally critical component.

options.text: The engineers correctly selected high-quality materials for the bridge.
Using low-quality steel in a vital part of the bridge was a serious mistake by the engineers.
The bridge collapsed because of an earthquake, not the materials.
The architect approved the use of substandard materials.

tasks.explanation: 'Should not have used' is a strong criticism of a past action. The poor-quality steel in a critical area was wrong.

short_description: Модальные перфектные конструкции: предположения, сожаления и выводы о прошлом.
